sen.j: 伏見宮邦家親王（ふしみのみや くにいえしんのう、享和2年10月24日 (旧暦)（1802年11月19日） - 明治5年8月5日 (旧暦)（1872年9月7日））は、江戸時代、幕末の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie (November 19, 1802 - September 7, 1872) was an Imperial family member at the end of Edo Period in Japan.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie (November 19, 1802 - September 7, 1872) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of Edo Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルと表記を合わせました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie (November 19, 1802 - September 7, 1872) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of Edo Period in Japan.

sen.j: 伏見宮第20代および第23代。
sen.e: He was the twentieth and the twenty-third prince of Fushimi no miya.
He was the twentieth and the twenty-third head of the Fushiminomiya family.
sen.cmt: 「第２０代、２３代伏見宮家当主」と解釈しました。英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was the twentieth and the twenty-third head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮貞敬親王の第1王子。
sen.e: He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki.
sen.cmt: Ref. 伏見宮貞敬親王（ふしみのみや さだゆきしんのう、安永4年12月10日（1776年1月1日） - 天保12年1月21日（1841年2月12日））
sen.e: He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki.
He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki.

sen.j: 幼称は睦宮（まさのみや）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Masanomiya.
His childhood name was Masa no miya.
His childhood name was Masa no miya.

sen.j: 父の貞敬親王は皇位継承候補として名が挙がったことがある。
sen.e: His father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki was once a candidate for successor to the throne.
sen.cmt: Ref. 伏見宮貞敬親王（ふしみのみや さだゆきしんのう）
sen.e: His father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki, was once nominated for an heir to the Imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: His father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki, was once nominated for an heir to the Imperial throne.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)14年（1817年）、光格天皇の猶子となり親王宣下を受ける。
sen.e: In 1817, he was adopted by Emperor Kokaku and given the title of Imperial Prince.
In 1817, he was adopted by Emperor Kokaku and given the title of Imperial Prince.
In 1817, he was adopted by Emperor Kokaku and given the title of Imperial Prince.

sen.j: 邦家と命名される。
sen.e: He was named Kuniie.
He was named Kuniie.
He was named Kuniie.

sen.j: 同月元服し、上野国太守に補任され三品に叙せられる。
sen.e: On the same month, his coming of age ceremony was celebrated, he was appointed governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).
sen.cmt: 「同月」とありますが前文、前前文などに何月かは明らかにされていません。
sen.e: In the same month, as his coming of age ceremony was held, he was appointed to the governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).
sen.cmt: On the same month -> In the same monthappinted -> appointed to
sen.e: In the same month, as his coming of age ceremony was held, he was appointed to the governor of Kozuke Province and granted Sanbon (the third rank of Imperial Prince).

sen.j: 天保6年（1835年）鷹司政熙の女鷹司景子（ひろこ）と結婚する。
sen.e: In 1835, he married Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
sen.cmt: 「女」は、歴史を調べたところ「娘」でした。
sen.e: In 1835, he married Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
In 1835, he married Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 天保12年（1841年）父貞敬親王が薨去したことにより伏見宮を相続する。
sen.e: In 1841, since his father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki passed away, he succeeded to Fushimi no miya.
sen.cmt: Ref. 伏見宮貞敬親王（ふしみのみや さだゆきしんのう）
sen.e: In 1841, since his father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki, passed away, and he succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family.
sen.cmt: 「家を継ぐ」という意味のため'family'を追記しました。
sen.e: In 1841, since his father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki, passed away, and he succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: しかし、翌天保13年（1842年）第6王子睦宮（よりのみや、後の伏見宮貞教親王）に家督を譲り隠居する。
sen.e: In 1842, however, he retired after transferring reigns of the family to his sixth son, Yorinomiya (later, renamed Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori).
However, in 1842 the next year, he retired after transferring reigns of the family to his sixth son, Yorinomiya (later, renamed Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori).
sen.cmt: the next year を追記しました。
sen.e: However, in 1842 the next year, he retired after transferring reigns of the family to his sixth son, Yorinomiya (later, renamed Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori).

sen.j: 親王は落飾し禅楽と号する。
sen.e: He became a Buddhist monk and was called Zenraku.
He became a Buddhist monk and was called Zenraku.
He became a Buddhist monk and was called Zenraku.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）2月7日 (旧暦)復飾を許され、伏見宮を再継承し、邦家の名に復帰した。
sen.e: On February 7, 1864 (in the old calendar), when his exclaustration was allowed, he succeeded to Fushimi no miya again and regained the name of Kuniie.
On March 14, 1864, when he was allowed to return to the secular life (exclaustration), he re-succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family and was again called Kuniie.
sen.cmt: 元治元年２月７日-> 西暦1864年3月14日「復飾」の定訳は補足的に使用しています。
sen.e: On March 14, 1864, when he was allowed to return to the secular life (exclaustration), he re-succeeded to the Fushiminomiya family and was again called Kuniie.

sen.j: 元治3年（2年説あり）3月二品に昇叙され、式部省卿となる。
sen.e: In March, 1866 (or 1865), he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince), and became Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial) kyo.
In March, 1866 (or 1865), he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince), and became Shikibusho-kyo (the Minister of Ceremonial).
In March, 1866 (or 1865), he was promoted to Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince), and became Shikibusho-kyo (the Minister of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 大政奉還がなると慶応3年（1867年）国事御用掛に任じられる。
sen.e: After Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), he was appointed Kokuji goyogakari (board member of national affairs) in 1867.
When Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) took place in 1867, he was appointed to Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair).
sen.cmt: Kokuji goyogakariのカッコ内補足説明を用語集に合わせました。大政奉還も1867年に行われたため、When...の文章に書き換えました。
sen.e: When Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) took place in 1867, he was appointed to Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair).

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）3月2日 (旧暦)、多年に渡り楽道に精進した功労などを賞され、一品に叙せされる。
sen.e: On March 2, 1868 (in the old calendar), he was granted Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince) in recognition of many years of his efforts in the field of court music.
On March 25, 1868, he was granted Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince) in recognition of many years of his efforts in the field of court music.
On March 25, 1868, he was granted Ippon (the first rank of Imperial Prince) in recognition of many years of his efforts in the field of court music.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）3月、家族とともに京都を離れて東京に移住する。
sen.e: In March, 1872, he and his family moved from Kyoto to Tokyo.
In April, 1872, he and his family moved from Kyoto to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 明治4年3月は旧暦のため、新暦では4月です。
sen.e: In April, 1872, he and his family moved from Kyoto to Tokyo.

sen.j: 4月10日 (旧暦)、家督を第14王子伏見宮貞愛親王に譲り隠居する。
sen.e: On April 10 (in the old calendar), he transferred reigns of the family to his 14th son, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanaru, and retired.
On May 16th, he transferred reigns of the family to his 14th son, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanaru, and retired.
sen.cmt: 明治５年4月10日 ->西暦1872年5月16日
sen.e: On May 16th, he transferred reigns of the family to his 14th son, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanaru, and retired.

sen.j: 同年8月5日 (旧暦)薨去。
sen.e: He passed away on August 5, 1872 (in the old calendar).
He passed away on September 7, 1872.
sen.cmt: 明治５年8月5日 -> 西暦1872年9月7日
sen.e: He passed away on September 7, 1872.
He died at the age of 71.
Died at the age of 71.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 71.

sen.j: 邦家親王は、父貞敬親王同様に子宝に恵まれた人であった。
sen.e: Prince Kuniie had many children as his father, Prince Sadayuki did.
sen.cmt: Ref. 伏見宮貞敬親王（ふしみのみや さだゆきしんのう）
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kuniie had many children as his father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki did.
sen.cmt: 定訳はPrince Kuniieですが、ファイル中で○○親王の表記を合わせるためImperialを追記しています。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kuniie had many children as his father, Imperial Prince Sadayuki did.

sen.j: 皇位継承問題の中で、男系を維持するために皇籍復帰を主張される昭和22年（1947年）に皇籍離脱した旧皇族11宮家は全て邦家親王が源流である。
sen.e: With succession to the Imperial throne becoming a subject of discussion, in 1947 returning to the Imperial family status was advocated in order to maintain the male line, but eleven former Imperial families seceded from the status, all of which were originated from Prince Kuniie.

Through the discussion of the succession to the Imperial throne, in order to maintain the agnate blood line, the eleven former Imperial families which renounced their imperial status in 1947 insist on rejoining: those families are all originated from Imperial Prince Kuniie.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Through the discussion of the succession to the Imperial throne, in order to maintain the agnate blood line, the eleven former Imperial families which renounced their imperial status in 1947 insist on rejoining: those families are all originated from Imperial Prince Kuniie.
